pageContext.claim: “Had that had this kind of numbers, 700,000 people would be dead right now.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a silly apples-and-oranges comparison. Because the swine flu was not nearly as lethal as the novel coronavirus, there was not nearly as much need to halt its spread. Since fewer precautions were taken to prevent infections, it’s misleading to calculate what the deaths would have been had the virus been more deadly. Even with 60 million infections, there were an estimated 12,500 deaths. (Note: That was an after-the-fact report, based on statistical modeling of excess mortality. The death toll at the time was much lower.)
